page.title: 11Sparetime Activities Wigan
page.content: Children in Base 8 asked their parents, relations and friends what they did in their spare time. We found the most popular activity was running. Others such as keep-fit, yoga, reading, cook- ing and bowling were also popular. Most men like football and snooker, women like knitting. Some of the unusual hob- bies are pigeon training and breeding, banjo playing, greyhound racing and making trailers for boats. Altogether 41 varied activities were listed. We also asked if they belonged to any clubs or organisations. Some families belong to Working Men's or Social Clubs and some mothers belong to the Mother's Union. Children's organisations were Brownies, Swimming Clubs, Comet Youth Club, Boys Brigade, Girls Brigade, Judo Clubs and a Morris Dancing Troup. Jane, Dan and Steven. Aged 9 St. James' School.
